Succession.definition: the order in which or the conditions under which one person after another succeeds to a property

1 a.definition: the order in which or the conditions under which one person after another succeeds to a property, dignity, position, title, or throne [the sequence of to the presidency]

sub_terms.b: the right of a person or line of ancestry to succeed
sub_terms.c: the line of ancestry having such a right

2 a.definition: the act or process of following in order

sub_terms.b: the act or process of one person's taking the place of another in the enjoyment of or liability for rights or duties or both

3.definition: the act or process by which a person becomes entitled to the property or property interest of a deceased person and esp. an intestatethe transmission of the estate of a decedent to his or her heirs, legatees, or deviseesthe estate of the deceased including assets and liabilities used chiefly in the civil law of Louisiana

1.definition: the transmission of property or property interests of a decedent as provided by statute as distinguished from the transfer in accordance with the decedent's willthe operation of such statutory provisions in transmitting intestate property [would take the property by]

2.definition: property that is not disposed of by will but by operation of statute [who presents himself to claim an""]

testate succession.definition: the transmission of property in accordance with a valid will

vacant succession.definition: an estate that has not been claimed, of which the heirs are unknown, or that has been renounced by all of the heirs

4 a.definition: the continuance of a corporation's status as a legal person [perpetual corporate ]

sub_terms.b: the act or process by which one corporation assumes ownership of another [documentsâ€¦that all aim to prepare your company for its new owner's "Saul Berkowitz"]

5.definition: the act or process by which one state takes over or follows upon another and becomes entitled to its rights and position in international law
